required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: NEAT - Prevention and Treatment of Overweight and Obesity.
clinical_study.official_title: Non-exercise Activity Thermogenesis (NEAT) - Prevention and Treatment of Overweight and Obesity

brief_summary.textblock: This study will investigate the effect on Non-exercise Activity Thermogenesis (NEAT) when implementing active workstation at offices compared to conventional office work. The primary hypothesis is that this implementation will lead to a significant increase in time spent walking per day.

detailed_description.textblock:
NEAT consists of the energy expenditure of the physical activities that are non sporting-like and that we perform in our everyday life, such as walking, cleaning, shoveling snow etc. Which occupation we have play a big role in how much we are able to active our NEAT during our days and those who have more active jobs can expend up to 1500kcal more per day than those with sedentary jobs.
This study aims to try and increase NEAT at offices where sedentary time often is high. Participants will be randomized to either an intervention group or to a control group. Participants in the control group will continue to work at their regular desk, but will receive an individual health talk in the beginning of the study where diet and physical activity recommendations will be discussed.Participants in the intervention group will receive the same individual health talk and a treadmill desk, which they will use for 12 months at self-selected speed. They will be recommended to walk on the treadmill for at least 1 hour per day.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in physical activity and sedentariness at 12 months
primary_outcome.description: Measured with an accelerometer (ActiGraph) and an inclinometer (ActivPAL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in metabolism at 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Metabolism: 2h glucose tolerance test. lipids, Hb1Ac

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in anthropometrics at 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Length, height, weight, waist circumference, hip circumference, sagittal height, pulse, blood pressure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in body composition at 12 months
Change from baseline in musculoskeletal pain at 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Measured with the Chronic Pain Grade Questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in stress at 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by assessing cortisol levels in the saliva at 4 time points during one day. Also measured with the stress- and energy scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in depression/anxiety at 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Measured with the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Quality of Life at 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Measured with 2 questions from the SF-36.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in cognitive Function and functional brain response at 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Measured with a cognitive test battery and functional MRI (fMRI). Levels of Brain-Derived Neurotrophic Factor (BDNF) is measured in the plasma.
Participants will be interviewed about experiences from being part of the study and about attitudes and factors that influences them to be physically active.

arm_group.description: Will receive a health talk with recommendations about diet and physical activity habits and will also receive a treadmill workstation at regular office site for 12 months.
Will receive a health talk with recommendations about diet and physical activity habits. Will continue to work with conventional office work at their regular desk.

intervention.description: The intervention group will receive a treadmill workstation for 12 months. They will use this at self-selected speed and will be recommended to use this for at least 1 hour per day. Participants in the control group will continue with conventional office work at their regular desk. Participants in the intervention group will receive four boosting e-mails during the study period, in which they will be encouraged to use the treadmill.
Participants in both groups will receive a health talk with recommendations about diet and physical activity habits.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Office workers with mainly sedentary tasks
- BMI 25-40
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe depression and/or anxiety
- Exhaustion disorder
- Diabetes Mellitus
- Severe cardiovascular disease
- Severe kidney disease
- Musculoskeletal disorders that prohibit walking on a treadmill
- Contraindications for physical activity
- Thyroidea illness
- Pregnancy
For fMRI-study, additional exclusion criteria are:
- Implanted metal- or electrical devices
- Pregnancy
- Extraneous metal pieces in the body
